content.webTitle: Nicky Henderson on the six to follow from his Lambourn stable

fields.headline: Nicky Henderson on the six to follow from his Lambourn stable
fields.bodyText: Binocular 'Physically he has done very well. He'll go to the Boylesports [at Cheltenham on 12 December]. There's a possibility he'll have a trip to Ireland at some stage. Of course, most of the opposition is over there – Solwhit and Hurricane Fly and all sorts of things' Punjabi 'In a perfect world he will go Fighting Fifth, Christmas Hurdle, probably the Kingwell at Wincanton, Champion Hurdle and Punchestown. He's the reigning champion and he deserves to be. You'd probably say he has improved' Zaynar 'Of all the horses Zaynar has made the most significant physical progress but then he was only a baby. I wouldn't be frightened to try 2½ miles. The Ascot Hurdle [on 21 November] wouldn't be a bad place to start this time' Petit Robin 'Our highest-rated chaser. If I could get him to go 2½ [miles], that would be fine. But at the moment we've only really been two [miles] with him and he's been chasing Master Minded and he's just inferior to him. But again he's only six, so he could improve' Jack The Giant 'Won his first start last year and came back with a suspensory problem. He won't start too early because we want to protect him, these things are quite tricky injuries. He'll be out in November but he's in good order at present. He's got so much stronger and better now' Caracciola 'Is off on an extraordinary mission. We are heading to Japan for a Flat race on 6 December worth $1.75m. I don't know what the stayers are like in Japan but I shouldn't think they've ever seen a 12-year-old before, so they'll get a surprise. He'll probably have one run over hurdles before he goes'
